roleset.name: like a lion
roleset.note: ROAR-V NOTES: Frames file for 'roar' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries weather-57, manner_speaking-37.3, Sound_Emission-43.2, and Animal_Sounds-38; Framenet entries Motion noise, Communication noise, and Perception noise. (from roar.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: ladylike
example.text: ``Get your feet off the table!'' Mary roared at John.

example.name: lions have only one arg
example.text: John heard the lion roar, but chose to ignore it.

roleset.name: move fast and noisily
roleset.note: ROAR-V NOTES: Frames file for 'roar' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries weather-57, manner_speaking-37.3, Sound_Emission-43.2, and Animal_Sounds-38; Framenet entries Motion noise, Communication noise, and Perception noise. (from roar.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: roaring twenties?
example.text: As the book begins, a newly wed Marlowe roars into the desert resort of Poodle (a.k.a. Palm) Springs at the wheel of a Cadillac Fleetwood.
example.arg: into the desert resort of Poodle (a.k.a. Palm) Springs
at the wheel of a Cadillac Fleetwood
